Description: Large fragment (mended from six) of Ionian pottery cup preserving rim and handle attachment; rim concave, not offset. Inside wholly glazed; outside, lip glazed save for reserved band near top; handle zone reserved with band near top; lower wall glazed with one reserved band; handle roots glazed. Two repair holes near foot.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA273, which is also repaired, but has no reserved band at top of lip.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. X, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE941)
